column2: Many people gathered at Abhayagiri on June 4, 2016, to meet old friends, celebrate and share reflections. Some sessions are not currently included pending teacher consent.

column3: Abhayagiri's 20th Anniversary - 16 - Closing Remarks by Ajahn Pasanno.mp3
column6: Closing Remarks by Ajahn Pasanno
Text
This is what heat is like.
Ajahn Pasanno attends Dharma Mastery Heng Lyu's ordination.
Background of the 20th Anniversary celebration.|| Explained by {teachers}.
A monastery isn't the buildings or the land, but it's the people.
Ajahn Pasanno's first impressions of Wat Pah Pong.
Ajahn Pasanno's motivations for moving to Abhayagiri; twenty years went by quick.
Explanation of paritta chanting.
Abhayagiri's neighbors and origins of the Abhayagiri property.
[Ajahn Pasanno](teacher:) expresses gratitude to the Saṅghapāla board members.
Reflections from Reverend Heng Sure.
A life-changing Dhamma talk.
Inviting monks to California to start a monastery.
Ajahn Sucitto's explanation of saṅghakamma redefines the focus of Saṅghapāla Foundation.
The best investment I ever made.
{teachers} introduces Ajahn Karuṇadhammo.
What we take with us.
Gratitude to Joseph Kappel.
The qualities of the heart are what really matters.
This is a broken glass.|Ajahn Chah
Ajahn Amaro hears of Master Hsuan Hua through Ajahn Sumedho.
I always thought I would never meet anyone else like Luang Por Chah, but I just met another one.|Ajahn Sumedho
Ajahn Sumedho asks Ajahn Amaro to go to California.
The virtual monastery in San Francisco.
Ajahn Sumedho delays the opening of a San Francisco vihara in 1992.
Master Hua offers land to Ajahn Sumedho the day after the Elders' Council approves a land search.
It had been the dream of my life to bring the Northern and Southern Traditions together again, and I never thought I was going to be able to do it until I met Sumedho.|Master Hsuan Hua
Testing times: Saṅghapāla Foundation scrambles to purchase the plot of land adjacent to Master Hsuan Hua's gift.||Recollected by {teachers}.
Moving onto the Abhayagiri land.
Abhayagiri 20 years later.
Origins of the Abhayagiri co-abbotship.
You can't have two tigers living in the same cave.|Ajahn Mahā Prasert
The connection with Ajahn Mahā Prasert and Casa Serena.
The world of things we leave behind, but the qualities of the heart are the abiding refuge.
The Sharing of Blessings (Chanting Book p. 33).
Closing Homage (Chanting Book p. 16).
